comment.author: 38896199@N06
comment._content: A fine picture, they were so well dressed and turned out! The Chef's uniform is the only one that hasn't really changed!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: And was wondering if he would have been called a chef or a cook, as in ship's cook? Have added cook to tags also...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 41675580@N08
comment._content:
No doubt the lady would have had at least some nursing training and be an important part of the Pursers Department.
The New Zealand Inter Island Ferries used to carry ladies in this position but got rid of them I believe.

comment.author: 93104394@N02
comment._content:
The gentleman on the right of the woman is my great grandfather John Davies, I have several photos of the SS Copeland. He came to Australia in 1912.

Christine

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/rolfiecar] That is fantastic to hear, Christine! Just to double check, you mean the gentleman on the right as we look at the photo?? I've added a note. Plus, great to hear that he moved to Australia in 1912, and thus escaped the Copeland's sinking in 1917... We have two photos of the S.S. Copeland that say "... per Mr Davis". Do you think this may have been an error, and that they were ordered by your great grandfather, Mr Davies?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 93104394@N02
comment._content: Yes that is correct on the right as we look at the photo. I saw these photo some time ago on the NLI site where it says per Mr Davis I thought the same thing about it being incorrect spelling for Mr Davies, although I do not have the original photos but I do have several of him on the Copeland. Im just new at Flickr and will upload these photos, but not sure how u will see them.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: If anyone'd like to see great photos of the S.S. Copeland and Steward John Davies, rolfiecar has just uploaded a gorgeous set...

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/rolfiecar] It's easy peasy to see them, Christine, now that you've loaded them up onto your photostream...  :)
